characters: STEVE AND DOUG AND MR. ZADIR
MR. BUTABI AND STEVE AND BARBARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we hear "What is Love" by HADDAWAY -- night falls and  partytime begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coconut Teaser, The Palace, The Roxbury, Tatou, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of random dancers -- gyrating, flirting, making out, drin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA MOVES THROUGH a crowded dance floor -- and  SETTLES ON the rhythmically swaying backs of...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Our heroes.  In their minds, Steve is tall, dark and hand -- except for the tall and little part.  They simultaneously turn and scope the room.  In unison,  their heads bop to the MUSIC.  Doug steps out from the  bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to O.S. female)  Hey!  You want to dance?  No?  Yes?  Alright, don't worry about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, rejected, steps back as Steve steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to O.S. female)  Do you want to dance?  You do?  You don't?  Not a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are no strangers to rejection, so neither is fazed.  Doug enthusiastically steps towards two attractive girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you wanna...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two attractive girls turn their backs to Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remaining positive)  No?  Maybe I'll see you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug steps back.  Steve spots GIRL AT end of BAR and  dances over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, do you want to dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully)  Alright, you know where I'll be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve steps back.  Doug sees a pretty woman on a balcony, waving to someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to each other)  You want him?  Me?  Him?  Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty woman waves them off, frustrated, and dissapears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Oh, you're okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn around to the bar, bartender is standing in  front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender, can I get a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender pays no attention and walks away.  Second  bartender comes from the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barkeep, what do you have on tap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second bartender ignores them, walks away.  The  bartenders keep crossing past the, paying no attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big guy, could I get a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My man, how 'bout a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'cuse me, partner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, buddy, I was wondering... you  know what?  Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn back to the dance floor and bop.  Suddenly, a  HOT GIRL dances in front of them.  Doug dances up behind her and frantically gyrates.  She  turns away -- only to find...  Steve gyrating behind her.  The guys close in on her  trapping her in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs off, furious.  The guys, unaware that she's  upset, celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Score!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They high five.  The doorman comes over with the upset  Girl and pulls the guys out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What's goin' on?  What's  your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The road flies by as we PAN UP the front grill of a red  BMW to reveal Doug and Steve.  The car stops next to two  girls in a white Porshe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got some sweetness on the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug Turns UP the STEREO really loud so the car is  pounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the girls)  What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the girls)  How you ladies doin' tonight?

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS' POV
dialogues.text: The guys moving their mouths -- but the girls can't hear  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn your music down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  Just follow us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a big stupid ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You have beautiful eyes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home, jerkoff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we'll meet you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light turns green.  Girls drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A neon sign reads "ROXBURY."

dialogues.speaker: ROXBURY CLUB FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: A huge muscular BOUNCER, wearing a headset, guards the  roped off area.  Doug and Steve confidently strut past  the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, this is the Roxbury.  No one  gets in unless you're on the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're brothers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slowly turn to each other and bust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They high five, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug is hilarious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you ever hear this one?  You're not on the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Steve and Doug, a '98 yellow FERRARI SCREECHES up  to the valet.  Car door opens and...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GRIECO
dialogues.text: gets out.  Looking great, in an Armani suit, beautiful  supermodel accompanies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beside himself)  Is that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.  The King of '21 Jump  Street.'  Richard Grieco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grieco quickly steps past Steve and Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Doug)  Check the wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the hottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bouncer jumps aside, letting them enter.  Richard  inadvertently rubs his nose as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Watching.  They both imitate his nose rub and try to  follow him in.  The Bouncer steps in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling at Grieco  like they know him)  Alright, we'll see you later then!  (to Bouncer)  You know what?  We're gonna take  off now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we'll hang out later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no chance of that  happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what was wrong with that  place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to say, since we didn't  get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a poorly run operation.  They can't properly evaluate the  incoming clientele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we just didn't look cool  enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.  You?  You're a beautiful  man.  I tell you what I'd do if it  were my club.  I would treat all  the outside wannabes just as well  as any legendary former television  star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty Roosevelt of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just what I believe in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police car drives behind them, turns on the SIREN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the SIREN mixes with their MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be the new dance mix version.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud speaker)  Pull over to the side of the road!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A female POLICE OFFICER signals them to pull over.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER'S WINDOW
dialogues.text: The officer steps up to their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you were doing fifty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling over radio)  What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches in, shuts OFF RADIO -- starts filling out  ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a twenty-five mile an hour  zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hottie cop likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think she pulls over anybody?  Mave a move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to her)  What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much, I'm just giving you an  eighty dollar ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is so into you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see your license and  registration?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve pulls the documents off the sun visor, hands them  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seductively)  I think I got what you're looking  for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes it, walks back to police car.  Doug adjusts the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: She's on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's calling her friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here she comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's my hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands Steve the papers and a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to do me a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, TJ Hooker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please obey any and all posted  speed limit signs.  Have a good  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already good, now that you've  served and protected me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs it off, walks away.  Doug takes the ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, my friend.  You got her  badge number plus a month from now  you have a date to meet her at the  Municipal State Court.  Up top!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Score!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They high five and PEEL OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a very downscale crowd, crappy cars, surrounding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely packed.  People are physically wedged up  against one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what it's all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big SECURITY GUY plows through the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks, we got to keep this area  clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd moves, sweeping the guys along.  Doug and Steve settle in a different spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a good feeling in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People, there's no lingering by  the exits!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it moves, Doug is engulfed in the crowd and  disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug?... Hey, Doug!... Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve is shoved away as the crowd moves again.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: jumps up and pops his head above the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: is wedged into a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: pops up near the entrance to the men's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug's face is wedged up against a mirror.  He struggles  to pull a cellular phone put of his pocket and dial.

dialogues.speaker: DANCE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Steve is wedged against a blinking light.  We hear a  cellular PHONE RING.  Steve reaches in his pocket and  pulls out his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, it's Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Doug.  So, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much.  Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug gets pushed up against a urinal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot of guys pulling down  their pants, so it's either the  bathroom or the V.I.P room.  Meet  me back at the bar.  If I don't  make it, I'll see you tommorow at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG hangs up.  O.S.  we hear someone UNZIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked)  Hey, just hold on a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two very bored club girls are standing up against a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, anyway, I'm standing there  waiting to use the pay phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he was.  Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this guy who's on the phone  turns around and tips his hat like  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG does a "tip your hat" motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who do you think the guy was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls still stone-faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio Estevez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mighty Duckman.  Swear to God.  I was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing)  Of course, you were.  You're the  one who yelled the breakfast  clubber's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was like -- 'Emilioooo!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, anyway... you guys want to  make out or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls stare at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys pull up.  Doug gets out and starts to pump gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Score some chippage.  I'll meet  you in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve exits into the AM/PM.  Doug notices a woman puttng gas into her car.  She feins a smile, looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug starts pulling the pump in and out of the gas tank -- simulating copulation.  She's repulsed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve looking at a bag of Pork Rinds.  Doug comes up from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, she's totally looking at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug motions toward the CASHIER.  She snaps her gum and  is reading People magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask her where the chips are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I know where they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG pushes him.  Steve walks over to the Cashier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I'm looking for the  potato chips.  You know, chips  made out of potato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're right behind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you really know what's going  on, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away and pretends to look at the chips.  Doug  gives him a thumbs up.  Richard Grieco enters the store and walks up to the  Cashier.  She lights up, recognizing Grieco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve walk up to Grieco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be cool)  Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember us?  We were at the  Roxbury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Grieco)  We were outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grieco turns to Cashier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I get a pack of Marlboro  Lights and that 12-pack of  Trojans.  Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cashier rings it up,  hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (obviously enamored)  Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grieco exits, they all watch.  Steve approaches Cashier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think I'm gonna need a 12-  pack of Trojans over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, they expire in two  years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve watch Grieco's Ferrari drive off as they  sit on the car and eat Pork Rinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That nabob has got it going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly envious)  Kickin' it at the Roxbury, rollin'  a banana Ferrari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tasty geisha by his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is a bag of chips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting him)  All that and a bag of chips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Well, we're doing okay.  I  got a number tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrilled)  Let me see it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve hands him a cocktail napkin.  Doug reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 555...?  Steve, this isn't real.  It's one of those fake T.V.  numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is, too.  I get this number all  the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least she respected me enough  to write a fake number.  We'll get  a real one one of these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of these days?  Steve, don't  you get it?  These are our days.  Now!  Today!  Ahora!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah whatta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug jumps off the car, starts pacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, we're young.  We're  supposed to purge ourselves of the  party virus or we'll just get so  clogged up that when we're like  forty we'll just explode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like one of those individual  plastic butters you get in the  diner.  You know, like when you  squish it, just bursts out all  over the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve makes explosion sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the butter, Steve.  I'm  trying to explain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)  Or like when you put an egg in a  microwave and all the yellow stuff  flies out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He mimes exploding egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an exceptional way to  visualize it but listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!  Remember in camp when we put  that can of beans in the fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it exploded.  Yes.  Steve!  If  we're ever going to live up to our  full potential, we've got to get  this partying out of our systems  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's do it!  Do it!  Woo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Do what?  Everything's closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)  Let's go home!  Wooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is a bad '80s combination of classical styles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN AROUND to see semi-juvenile furniture -- which is  overwhelmed by a huge stereo system.  Doug sleeps, mouth open.  A piece of red licorice reaches INTO FRAME and starts darting in and out of Doug's mouth. He coughs and waves it away.  The licorice starts going  up his nostril.  Doug wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Knock it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twizzled you, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you totally got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE laughs at this, starts eating the licorice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was in my nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve stops eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two giant Great Danes plow through, knocking over plates. We meet their dad, KAMEHL BUTABI, fifties, Eugene Levi-  type, with some sort of Middle Eastern accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain!  Tenille!  Stop that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and Doug, in silk bathrobes, hair completely  disheveled, enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this.  Barbara, look who's  honoring us with their presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We meet their mom, BARBARA BUTABI, well kept trophy wife. She tries to straighten out their hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma!... come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing Doug orange  juice)  Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rejecting juice)  Mom, I'm trying to get my body to  enter the zone, so I can optimize  my fat-burning potential, and  orange juice does not help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, according to 'Fit for Life'  the idea of a balanced breakfast  is a fallacy.  Your body is only  prepared to accept one form of  food in the A.M. -- fruit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve grabs the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can putrefy your insides if  you want to.  But, I'm having a  cup of cooked oatmeal, one  tablespoon protein power...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Doug continues, Mr. Butabi gets more and more annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and four soy sausage links.  (to Steve)  That's how you hit your peak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)  Quick, Barbara, look at Doug.  He  is hitting his peak.  You don't  want to miss this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, if you're going to hit your  peak, do it in your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I want for breakfast is some  sliced mangos and persimmons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough, you two.  Your  mother is not the maid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, can you tell the maid I want  some sliced mangos and persimmons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you both at work in half an  hour.  And, Steve wear something  nice.  Emily's back from school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Dad, but I think you're  confusing Steve for someone who  gives a flying rat's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, a flying rat's ass.  That  would be wild to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kamehl, they'll be there.  Just  let them have their breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Eat.  They need their  strength so they can stay out all  night for their dancing and their  orgies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your information, Dad, Doug  and I were not able to find an  orgy last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara, explain something to me.  They graduate from high school and what  do they do?  Nothing.  Do they go  to college?  No.  Do they take any  intrest in my business?  No.  Do  they think about the future?  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, if you know all the answers,  why do you keep asking the questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half an hour.  I want to see your  dance club asses at the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi exists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Staying Alive" by the BEE GEES.  Set of shoes walking, a la the opening of Saturday Night Fever.  We WIDEN to another set of shoes -- PAN UP to reveal Doug and Steve, strutting down the street like John Travolta.  Each holds a silk plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the guys pass.  They stop and hold up their cell  phone to the one in the window -- same way Travolta did  with the shoe.  A beautiful WOMAN walks by.  They turn to look at her  ass.  They run back and stand in front of her. She  pushes them aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits.  They continue.  They pass a cappucino  cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Single or double?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other to confirm their choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk with their iced cappucinos in bubble top cups  with straws.  MUSIC FADES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and Doug enter holding silk plants.  Mr. Butabi  walks up to them, takes the plants.  Doug is wearing a  Walkman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Steve, you have a customer.  Doug, go ring that man up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both nod agreeably.  Steve exists.  Doug doesn't  move, still listening to the Walkman.  Mr. Butabi pulls  his walkman off and points at the register.  Doug exists.

dialogues.speaker: CASH REGISTER COUNTER
dialogues.text: Doug steps behind the counter, helping a COUPLE with seve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will you be paying for this?  Cash, check or charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling it out)  Charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at it)  Visa, Mastercard, or Discover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move your thumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug moves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Visa.  Good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug makes a "you got me" motion.  He slides the card  through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think something's wrong with  your card.  You sure this is  yours?  'Cause it's not  processing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better call it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operator 238 please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR, with headset, in front of computer, answers phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authorization.  Card number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, I told you not to call anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to get an approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The card's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the card, sweetness.  Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and swipe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can go for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug swipes it through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... that feel good?  'Cause I  could swipe it all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug keeps swiping it.  The couple looks at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine.  Good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up.  Doug happily hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (notices couple  still waiting)  ... Oh, can I help you with  something?

dialogues.speaker: ROW OF SILK FERNS
dialogues.text: A middle-aged lady CUSTOMER is perusing.  Steve walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, may I show you around  the Silk Garden.  Home of a  wondrous variety of flora and  fauna -- all made of silk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are these supposed to be ferns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what people will say.  But  guess what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers in ear)  ... it's not real.  It's silk.  (acting in shock)  Oh, be careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've accidentally wandered into  the Enchanted Forest.  Allow me to  be your guide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve ducks behind the four or five silk trees that make  up the "forest" and sticks his head out from between two  trees -- now wearing a safari hat.  He picks up a    wate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I just did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just watered your plant for a  whole year.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DIORAMA OF NIGHT
dialogues.text: It's a show box on the register counter, cut up silk  flowers inside.  Doug is making two figures dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (male voice)  What's up?  You want to dance?  (female voice)  With you.  Oh, God, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug slams the figures together, singing a dance song.  Mr. Butabi enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug pulls the diorama away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't spend enough time in  dance clubs?  You have to cut up  my plants, and make toys of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This club had a jungle theme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling off)  Carlos!  Come work the cash  register.  (to Doug)  You get your brother and load  the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLOS, middle-aged assistant manager, steps behind  counter.  Doug grabs the diorama and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next door to "BUTABI'S SILK GARDEN" is "BRIGHT IDEA" lamp store.  Steve gingerly loads a tree into the store van.  Doug tosses his in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve!  Steve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve starts to turn.  Doug tries to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILY ANDERSON, a plain over-eager girl, early 20s,  bounces out of the lamp store, holding a CHANDELIER in  one hand that TINKLES every time she moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Steve.  Hey, Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Emily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning away)  Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I guess you're back from  school and working in the lamp  store again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me.  I got to talk to my  brother a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug pulls Steve aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, do you like her or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you talking to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's talking to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, look at me.  It is your  destiny to be with a variety of lady  girls.  Not just one lamp store  troll.  And quite frankly, your level  of looks is way above her level of  looks.  So for her own good, just  walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Steve, you gonna ask me out  'cause I think we could have a really  good time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug annoyed, steps between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, chicklet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem.  Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, I don't know if you know  this, but my brother and I?  We  live life in the fast lane.  That  means no stop signs, no red  lights, and no pulling over to  take pictures.  Now you see this  man over here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug motions to Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my co-pilot on this magic  carpet ride.  It's a two-man  operation.  One -- two --  (points at Emily)  -- crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh!  I just don't want you to get  hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their father walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their father puts his arm around Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know my son, Steve, here,  likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, frustrated, walks away.  FRED ANDERSON, Emily's  overweight father, walks over, also holding a CHANDELIER  and TINKLING, puts his arm around Emily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gregarious)  Mr. Butabi, is Steve asking Emily  to marry him again?  Ha, ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, ha, with the way they carry on, I  think they're already planning their  honeymoon, Mr. Anderson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha.  Ha.  Did I tell you?  I've  already booked a wedding band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha.  Ha.  Yes, and if they have  enough grandchildren we won't have to  hire salesmen anymore.  Ha, ha, ha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug stands behind them and mocks laughing along with  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kamehl, you kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you kill me.  You murder me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he walks away)  ... salesmen.  That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily waves good-bye to Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, can you just leave Steve alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Your brother likes the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, nothing personal, but Emily's  like a pigwoman from a planet of pig  people.  And she's trying to take  Steve on her porky little spaceship  so she can take him back to the  Planet Pig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Doug, you know what they eat on  the Pig Planet?  Bacon and sausage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)  Nice call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They high five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every once in a while I'll hit pay  dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all too bad, because that  girl is going to be his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Doug)  You know, they could also eat ham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough of pig talk.  Doug, do you  see this wall?  When they marry,  we can knock it down.  Then  combine stores and have the first  plant/lamp store.  And Steve and  Emily can run it and it's up to  them if they want to keep you  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you seeing planes?  Is your  name Tatu?  Because I think you're  living on Fantasy Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, that was a sweet show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I have a fantasy.  That I  have two capable sons who listen  to me.  Look how you load the  truck.  You've done enough damage  for one day.  Get out of here.  I'm sick of both of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their father slams the van closed and exits into the  store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we're on a break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to Crunch it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I'll Crunch.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: of the cardiovascular room.  Long line of stairmasters,  treadmills, etc.  We PASS people working out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Stacey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STACEY rolls her eyes at them and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty, work it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ritchie, you're the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys stop to look at a WOMAN on the inner thigh  machine.  She opens and closes her legs, notices them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look back up and walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom-meee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve raises his hand to high five a bodybuilder, who  ignores them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge muscle guy is looking in the mirror as he pumps a  barbell.  Doug and Steve step over.  This is the first  time we see them, in their gym attire -- tight Spandex  pants, mesh tank tops and giant weight belts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, can the rest of us use  the mirror?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The muscle guy moves over.  Doug picks up a small    dumb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pumps it)  How's my form?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking good.  Relax the  shoulders... breathe through it...  lift don't swing... feel the  burn... stitch in time... and let  me hear this one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)  Aaaaaaaaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaaaaaaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug finishes, drops dumbbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet pump.  Got some veinage  going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two girls walk over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Steve)  Ask me what time it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I know what time it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hotties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...  (loudly)  Excuse me, do you know what time  it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Let me check my watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug elaborately twists his arm to look at his watch --  flexing his triceps and displaying them to their full  advantage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... think it's... quarter three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug stays unnaturally in that position till the girls  leave.  He relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies love triceps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRAIG, an overenthusiastic trainer, steps up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug!  Steve!  What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking large, gentlemen.  You  guys want the rest of my power  bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- holding it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding it up)  No, we got a Nitro bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding it up)  How 'bout an Energy Booster Bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding it up)  No, we got a Muscle Triplicator  Bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but let me know if you need  some carbs.  I got a case of  'carbolicious' in the back.  But  supplements aside, can I get some  quality time with you fellas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in between sets.  Lay it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long we been friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All seven years of high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  That's why I got to be  real with you now.  And I'm not gonna  sugar coat it.  As a professional  trainer,  I'm a little worried about  your pecs.  You guys don't go all the  way down.  It's called full  extension.  And I'm not seeing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, you're right.  We actually had  a long talk about that the other  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't want you to cheat  yourselves.  I'm sorry I had to come  down on you like this, but in a weird  way, that's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's why we love you and we  hate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad we had this talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we don't talk, we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very fit AEROBICS TEACHER stands on a mini-stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody, I'm Shelley.  Are  you ready to Cardio-Funk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!... Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man, you are hilarious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They high-five.  MUSIC STARTS.  "MOVE YOUR BODY" by  Amber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!  Here comes the countdown!  Three... two... one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN a line of aerobicizers.  Everyone is in synch --  except Doug and Steve, who work out chaotically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and kick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone kicks.  But, they continue their hyper dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone reaches.  They continue being out of synch.  Suddenly, they stop, put fingers on their necks and stare up at a clock.  Simultaneously, they go right back into  their manical dance.  MUSIC ENDS.  Everyone but Doug and Steve stop.  People  stare at them.  They continue in silence, then slowly  wind down as they notice people staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright!  Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cardio-funk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Shelley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley stares at them.  After a few uncomfortable beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve simultaneously put on their sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we go back to work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shaked it, let's bake it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys drive along highway in BMW.  Ocean on one side.  Steve stares off at the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Steve and Doug, waist up.  They have lotion caked  up unevenly on themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I told Dad we should put  some ferns and some silk banana  trees in front of the store.  'Cause then passersby and the like  could see 'em and we could attract  more customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsure what he just  heard)  Moonwalk that by me again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just said I was talking to Dad  about the store and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The store?  You're sitting around  thinking about the store?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where we work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding)  That's right.  And is that all you  want to do with your life?  Is  that all you think we're capable  of doing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hot bikini babes walk past them.  Guys immediately  stop arguing and turn.  We --

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: -- to see the guys full body, for the first time.  They're wearing black Gucci G-string bathing suits.  They flex and hold uncomfortable body positions to show off  their muscles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to go for a swim or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strangled, twisting  arm unnaturally)  ... about quarter after... five

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls walk away.  The guys stop flexing and resume  their argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- capable of doing with our  lives!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Doug, why are you Mt. St.  Helensing on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I want more for you.  I  care about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is so sweet of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  And you deserve better.  You deserve to get into the  Roxbury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, there's a list.  You have to  be like a Richard Grieco type guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, we are the Richard Grieco type  guys.  We should be on that list.  We're 'A' club people leading a  'B' club life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been going to 'B' Clubs?  Why didn't you ever tell me this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to hurt your feelings.  I know how sensitive you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause we settle.  'Cause we keep  going to all those 'B' clubs ever  night  They can smell 'B' club on us  like barf in a bathroom.  From now  on, the only club we go to is the  Roxbury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, how --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can.  And we will.  Because no  matter how many lists and roped  off areas the big bouncer in the  sky throws in front of us, we will  get through.  You know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're good-looking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good-looking.  You especially.  Now, repeat after me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'After me.'  Sorry.  I'm just  kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (completely serious)  And it was hysterical.  I'm just not  laughing to preserve the drama of the  previous moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood.  Continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat after me.  We can get in the  Roxbury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can get into the Roxbury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxbury!  Roxbury!  Roxbury!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leap up and down.  Two girls walk by.  They  immediately stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi, Mrs. Butabi, Fred Anderson, MABEL ANDERSON,  Fred's middle America wife, and Emily are having coffee  in the living room.  Emily is obviously dressed up to  attract Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mid-conversation)  ... And then, and I swear this is  true, someone came into the store  today and thought it was a real  plant store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would not kid about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve burst in, still in their black Gucci G-  strings, head up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Andersons here.  Get dressed  and come join us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve!  Sorry, Dad, we're busy  tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your bathing suit, Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Emily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, whatever, Emily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you, folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys rush upstairs.  Suddenly, we hear MUSIC pounding from their room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi goes upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are picking out their clothes in the closet  Mr. Butabi enters and shuts off the MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I tell you to do something, you  do it.  And what is this business  of coming in naked.  Put on your  pants and come down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't on our 'Things to do' list.  Daddy-o.  Steve and I have  something extremely important to  do tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, to come downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug goes in their bathroom and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can I not get through to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, Doug is like a fax machine.  You just keep putting things in,  face down, and you need to have a  cover page, because if you don't  -- people don't know where it's  coming from and sometimes you  don't get through on the first  call.  That's why you got a redial  button and a memory button  because... you know... actually, I  never use those buttons.  I always  screw it up.  I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug opens the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Steve)  Don't try to explain it to him.  He'll never understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I understand.  You are going  out tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't understand what  you're driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi takes their keys off the dresser and grabs  their cell phones and starts to exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Dad!  What are you doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily is standing, singing "Memories" from Cats.  Everyone is listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Memories, all alone in the  moonlight...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred nods "isn't she good" to Kamehl, who agrees.  Steve and Doug, dressed to kill, stomp down the stairs.  Doug turns to Mr. Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can take away our phones.  You  can take away our keys.  But, you  can't take away our dreams!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  'Cause we're like  sleeping when we have them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys exit.  Steve pauses a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, nice voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Butabi runs after them, holding old brick-sized  cell phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys!  Boys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like you going out without  a phone.  What if something  happens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands them the cell phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, these are embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it in case of emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses them and walks back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Ma get lipstick on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it looks like you were  making out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In b.g., Mom gets knocked over by Great Danes.  No one  notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the van driving down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug Pulls down sun visor, checks his hair.  Tries rear-  view mirror -- still good.  Then leans across Steve,  who's driving, and looks in the driver's side  view mirror -- still good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, how's my hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxbury good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it.  How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robust and attractive.  I gotta  tell you -- tonight, I can taste  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve doesn't respond and suddenly SLAMS the BRAKES.  Doug gets thrown forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (completely losing  it)  I can't taste it, Doug!  I can't!  I'm so scared right now I don't  know what to do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calming him down)  Bro, you're mad cowing on me.  Relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm nervous, man.  We've put all  this pressure on ourselves to get  into the Roxbury, and I don't know  if we can deliver!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta take control of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you gotta take control!  I am  barely hanging on here!... You...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve starts crying.  Doug cradles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa... settle down... relax...  think puppies and candy canes...  easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug notices two girls walking by the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (completely  recovered)  How you doing, little lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From O.S., a beer BOTTLE flies INTO FRAME at them and  SMASHES on the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  Maybe later then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, I see your Roxbury balloon, and  I hate to be the one to burst it.  I  just don't think our names are on  that list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, get real.  The bouncer isn't  checking a list.  He's checking us.  Man, I can't believe all this time,  that's what you thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why didn't we ever get in before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were kids.  We were completely  immature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that was last night.  And now we  don't even have our car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.  Rites of passage.  Like  that Africa show on P.B.S.  When it's  time for a boy to become a man, they  send him to the jungle with nothing  but a spear to hunt the lion  The van is our spear and the Roxbury is  our lion.  And when the hunt is over,  we shall be men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does the bouncer know about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Steve, what really matters  is that at the end of the night --  when all is said and done and all  hotties have been hit upon -- if  either of us has just one girl's  number, just one, then we'll know,  for the first time in our lives,  we're really worth something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys pull up -- get out.  Steve tosses Doug the keys. Doug tosses the keys to the valet -- who ignores them.  Keys fall to the ground.  Doug runs over, picks up keys  -- hands them to the valet.  Walks back to Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storm the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take no prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve try to walk/bop up to the Bouncer.  They  wave to people who aren't there, trying to act cool, and  attempt to walk in.  Bouncer stops them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, my good hombre, remember us  from last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're brothers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Works every time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I remember.  You can't come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flashy guy walks past them, in SLOW MOTION, slapping a  fifty dollar bill into the Bouncer's hand and entering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Steve)  Okay, it's time to play a little  softball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, my good man.  How's it going  tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  You're still not getting in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's not what a good  friends of mine told me.  Maybe you  know him?  His name is Abraham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug drops a five dollar bill on the Bouncer's clipboard. The Bouncer doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout his two friends?  George  Washington and... George  Washington?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve drops two one-dollar bills.  The Bouncer doesn't  move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not forget the other boy in  the band, Mr. Hamilton.  He's a  little lonely, wants to join his  buddies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG holds out a ten.  He waves it up and down, sideways, drops it, but the Bouncer still doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait up, look what we got here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve reaches into his pocket, pulls out some change,  starts dropping coins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jefferson, Jefferson,  Lincoln...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Roosevelt, Roosevelt,  Roosevelt, Roosevelt, and a  commemorative coin -- '84  Olympics -- what a proud chapter  in Angelino history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bouncer looks down and turns his clipboard over,  dropping all the money to the ground.  OFF guys'  reaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van stops and starts as they look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve stops.  They look out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not an A.T.M.  That's where  you drop off your videos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, there's one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve stops short.  They look out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a yellow FERRARI BARREL into the back of the  flower van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are thrown forward.  All the plants are thrown  on top of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Grieco is driving the other car, BLONDE MODEL  with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!  The car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car?  What about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this car is illegal.  All I  need is a police report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a racing car.  I imported it  illegally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys slowly get out of their van, dazed, dragging  plants as they get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug slowly bops his head, feeling if there's anything  loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, great.  They're starting in  with the neck injuries.  I'm  screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both guys check if their heads still work.  Grieco comes  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sorry about your car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.  Richard Grieco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, we saw you last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grieco nods, unsure, but agreeable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Richard)  Like Walt Disney says, my man,  'It's a small world after it all.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, are you guys alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My neck hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re:  cars)  Right, so, what do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were just going to the Roxbury  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we couldn't get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys want me to get you  in the Roxbury?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grieco goes back to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?  It all comes from within.  And he felt it.  Because he's an  actor and he's very sensitive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys get back in the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put in 'D' and blast me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve shoots Binaca spray into Doug's mouth and shifts.

dialogues.speaker: GRIECO'S CAR, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Grieco is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to make a stop at the Roxbury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want a lawsuit, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Grieco walks with the Blonde Model, Steve and  Doug trailing behind, walking past a huge line of club  goers.  Steve starts breathing heavy -- he's nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, keep it together.  Think  F-R-A. Focus, rhythm, attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it... Fra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all reach the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Grieco.  Nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bouncer)  That's right.  We're with Richard  Grieco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to line of people)  That's right.  Grieco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red velvet curtains.  Steve and Doug push through the  curtains and are stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful, sexy, expensively dressed people mill around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Doug, this is the most  amazing place I've ever been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys!  This is the coat room.  The club's in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys follow Grieco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys enter with Grieco.  MUSIC BLASTING. Long,  crowded bar, odd-shaped velvet couches, model types are  Velcroed to the walls, huge crowded dance floor.  This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)  ...Sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys follow Grieco, greeting passing women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whats' up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?...  (faster)  What's up, what's up, whats' up,  what's up, what's up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve!  Get a hold of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, it's hottie overload in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pace yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (counting to himself)  ... What's up?... two, three...  What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. ZADIR, the club owner, 45, Armani suit, magnanimously greets them, holding a drink -- he speaks with a foreign  accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, my man!  Good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny.  Place is kickin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's jumping.  Like '21  Jump Street,' right?  Ha!  (to Steve and Doug)  My children watch the reruns on  T.V. land.  (to Grieco)  Who are your friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, guys, this is Mr. Zadir.  He  owns this place.  These are uh..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you my V.I.P. table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They follow Zadir through the crowd.  As they walk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Steve)  Oh my God!  The owner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the man who pulls the  strings.  The Gepetto of party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, he's the owner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh!  Listen and learn, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at a table overlooking the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving to someone O.S.)  Yes!  I see you!  Excuse me, I  have to say hello to Bob Saget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you guys come here a lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, we're never been inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grieco and his date look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside)  Steve, what are you saying, be  cool.  (to Grieco)  So, is Johnny Depp meeting you  here or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  So you guys look like you  really know how to party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, we never stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're pretty much out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir returns, shouting behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bob O.S.)  I get it, Bob, the club is  crowded, so it's a 'Full House'  like your show.  (to Richard)  He's too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grieco and his date start to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny, we'll see you at the party.  I'll see you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya.  Richard Grieco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Blonde)  Their necks looked alright, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grieco and Blonde exit.  A waiter puts a bottle of  champagne on the table and Zadir begins to pour glasses  -- he's obviously had a few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I just want to say, and I mean  this with the utmost sincerity, it is  an honor to shoot the shit with the  owner of the club of all clubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and we're proficient club  hoppers -- so we know what we're  talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, we usually go this place  called 'The Palace' and that place is  rank.  The music is ancient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no celeb citings and the women  are oinkers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they let any asswad in the  door.  It's the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I own that place also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's a really good  location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the drinks are reasonably  priced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  You are right.  That's  what's wrong with this club  business.  One day you are hot  next day you are not.  People get  bored easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know I had this great  idea.  You should make this place  like a tropical jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, lots of silk plants and  vines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but they're not real vines.  They're bungee cords and people  could like swing from one end to  the other so if you left your  friends at the bar, you could get  back to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir is half listening to them as he drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and the barmaids could wear  loincloths -- but tasteful.  Like  the ones they wear in strip clubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could not insure bungee cords.  People jumping back and forth.  Too expensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Hit delete on that one.  Doug, tell him about your street  idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just thinking, you know how  people get bummed waiting outside  to get in the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zadir nods, listening to this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good.  You're gonna love  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you make the outside of the  club look like the inside.  You  know, you put down a rug outside  and some couches and pipe out some  music.  People will love it.  But,  then on the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is the good part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Looks like the street.  You  know, you park some cars inside, a  mailbox, street signs, and that  way when they come in, it's like  the outside is the inside and  inside is the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't that blow your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurts my brain to think about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMBI and VIVICA, predatory model types, scope out the  place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He owns a restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uch.  How'd he get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)  ... Look, I don't see anything  over six figures... So, let's just  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivica stabs out her cigarette, begins to pack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second.  That's that Zadir  guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivica looks up.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE AND DOUG AND MR. ZADIR
dialogues.text: laughing and drinking champagne.  CAMBI and VIVICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad he's married.  He owns all  the clubs in town.  Plus, dry  cleaners, that beeper service, and  Mailboxes, Etc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are those guys with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambi reaches into her purse and pulls out Money  magazine's richest people issue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find them, but if they're  with Zadir, they've got to be  worth something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  Let's work.

dialogues.speaker: TABLE
dialogues.text: The guys are pitching Zadir another idea, GILBERT  GOTTFRIED comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  Benny!  Benny!  Benny!  Benny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gilbert Gottfried, who let you in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to say hello to my friend  at the other table.  Not this  table.  No.  No.  The other one.  Looks like this table -- other  people around it.  I have a friends  and he needs you to say hello to  him at the other table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  You got me!  I didn't  see it coming.  No.  It was coming  but I was not able to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better go before he explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gilbert and Zadir walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)  Was I too pushy?  I was too pushy.  Did I speak well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were totally articulate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he didn't like our ideas.  It's hard to pitch in a night  club.  You ever notice, the music  is blasting in here.  We should  try to get a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve starts looking off at something, mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Steve, what if we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug sees what Steve is watching.  He also becomes  mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: CAMBI AND VIVICA
dialogues.text: In SLOW MOTION, like two cars, the girls saunter across  the dance floor, toward Steve and Doug.  STEVE and DOUG  even more mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: CAMBI AND VIVICA
dialogues.text: even closer.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE AND DOUG
dialogues.text: still staring at the girls.  The girls walk up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on automatic)  Up what's?  You want to dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, she said 'Yes.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)  Hotties want to shake it, come on.

dialogues.speaker: DANCE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Steve and Doug surround the girls and frenetically  gyrate, pushing into them.  The girls escape and Steve  and Doug end up slam dancing against each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys!  Over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambi takes Doug's hand.  Vivica grabs Steve's hand.  "This is Your Night" by AMBER starts.  The following is a perfectly choreographed dance to the music.  The girls dance seductively, dancing toward the boys.  Doug and Steve, unsure what's going on, look at each  other.  Simultaneously, the girls start to mimic the girls'  moves.  The boys do some hand jive, the girls match them   perfec They begin a variety of dips, swings and techno style  dances.  They're incredible.  The crowd watches them...  Doug and Steve start doing some moves together.  An impressed JOHN TRAVOLTA comes over to them.  John adds his own movements and the guys follow suit.  John, Steve, Doug, and the girls do a synchronized  dance.  THE MUSIC STOPS.  Crowd cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Travolta)  Bro, you are incredible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, unbelievable stuff out  there.  So, you want to hang out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travolta starts to exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, catch you later then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir's black limo is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, Steve, Mr. Zadir, Vivica and Cambi are inside.  Zadir pops open a bottle of Dom Perignon and starts  pouring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, 1980, good year!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, '80 was an excellent year.  Devo had a big hit that year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and 'Joanie loves Chachie'  started that year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was just a cheap spinoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a spinoff?
