dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, those characters  originated on 'Happy Days.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, 'Joanie Loves Chachi.' But,  does Chachi give a Fuck about Joanie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambi makes a good point.  But  tonight we should have fun, not dwell  on Scott Baio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drinking)  Sweet suds, Mr. Zadir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom Perignon's good but you know what  really makes a party -- Redi Whip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not like when you put it on  stuff.  It's when you're half  pressing on that little white nozzle  and like before it comes out, you  suck on it, and it's really fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like nitrous oxide?  Whippets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback)  ... No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dumbfounded)  Tscha!  What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir lowers the panel between the driver and the  rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to driver)  Dooey!  We must stop and get Redi  Whip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOOEY, 35, black suit and tie, looks in a rearview mirror

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zadir raises the panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dooey)  But it has to be Redi Whip in a can!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, he can't hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zaidir lowers the panel, nods to Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just saying it has to be  Redi Whip in a can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)  Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zadir raises the panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He really can't hear us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dooey, tell your mother I had a  really good time last night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean your sister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys high five.  Cambi and Vivica exchange looks of  disbelief.  Dooey lowers the panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir, I'm pulling over here  to get whipped cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dooey pulls over and gets out.  Doug looks out the  window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches Dooey talking to the cash register person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dooey hands the cash register person a credit card, who  swipes it.  Doug rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operator 238, please... What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same Switchboard Operator he talked to at the  store.  The following conversation is INTERCUT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned)  Hello, Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess where we went tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see, the 7-11 on Ventura?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean, before this, you sly  little credit vixen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Roxbury with Richard Grieco  and Bob Saget.  You gotta come out  sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would.  But then there'd be no  one to approve all the money you  spend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're always thinking of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The card's good.  'Bye, Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up.  Doug hands the phone back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She approved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Modern style house.  Lights dot a gravel driveway that  leads to the entrance.  The limo drives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet ass cottage, Mr. Zadir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERE'S A PARTY IN FULL SWING.  Spice Girls are   perform

dialogues.speaker: PATIO DOOR
dialogues.text: opens.  Doug, Steve, Mr. Zadir and the girls enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir, I am very impressed.  For a guy who owns sleazy night  clubs, the decor in your house is quite  tasteful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys nod to each other, proud of their compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse us, we're going to the  ladies' room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls walk off.  Mr. Zadir notices something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna Nicole!  Put something on!  You are making us sick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel it, Steve?  We are  finally experiencing the party  lifestyle to the fullest degree.  Let's mingle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk over to a Fabio type MODEL GUY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it hanging?  You want to  mingle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool party, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (who the hell are  these guys)  ... I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd say it's kicking into  gear right about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and Doug pause a moment.  Model Guy looks at each  of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right.  So are we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hard job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know, like you got to  stand still all the time and uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (racking his brain)  ... Standing still.  Standing  still is really hard.  My foot  cramps sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean.  What agency  you with?  Elite, Ford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Model)  So, do you like mingling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Model Guy walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off at Model Guy)  See you on the shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they start eating their pasta primavera again, a NAKED WOMAN emerges from the pool and walks directly towards  them.  Steve and Doug forget how to chew and stand,  stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you pass me a towel, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They talk directly to her breasts, trying to be  nonchalant, but answering questions she hasn't asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... about eight o'clock, eight  fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're right behind you.  Can you  just reach over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  All the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sagittarius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BMW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right off Sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanilla mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoves by them and exits.  Mr. Zadir comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this, I have the Spice  Girls, yet nobody is dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys snap out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due party-throwing  respect, you know what the problem  is, Mr. Zadir?  This pool is  taking up all the prime dancing  real estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know, if there were a big  piece of glass you could put over the  pool, you could use it as a dance  floor.  And it would be really sweet  because people would feel like they  were dancing on water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you could put fish in the water  and it would be like the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or, Doug, you know what would be  another amazing idea?  You could have  a special room for people who want to  dance naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, then you could have a room next  to that room with a one-way mirror so  other people could watch them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calming them down)  Boys, boys, please let's not talk  business.  We'll schedule a meeting  for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys silently/joyously high five their meeting.  Cambi,  Vivica enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protective)  Of who?  We'll kick his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we got scared someone stole  you away from us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve ponder the meaning of this statement for a beat, having rarely heard a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizes it's a  compliment)  Oh...  (to Steve)  Like some other girls would steal  us away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right... Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir, would you mind if we  borrowed them for a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No!  (laughs)  Got you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good one, Mr. Zadir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He totally got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir, let me just say that  you, sir, are a load and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)  Thank you, Doug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys and girls exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are entertaining the girls with their killer  impression of Hall & Oates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)  ... Oh, oh, here she comes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys do a "here she comes" step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out, boy, she'll chew you  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug chews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, here she comes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a maneater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls look blankly at them.  The guys stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess who that was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was supposed to have a  moustache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny and Cher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we'll give you another hint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys get into their Hall and Oates positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)  She's a rich girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)  And she's going to go far 'cause  she knows it doesn't matter  anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambi stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shutting them up)  Guys, guys!  I have an idea.  You  want to have some fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, fun is our last name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, fun spelled backwards is  'nuf.'  And you can never have  'nuf' fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes Steve by the hand)  Great.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're staying in here.  And  we're going in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivica pulls Steve into an adjoining guest bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as the door shuts)  Steve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivica sits on the bed.  Steve awkwardly stands by the  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's great.  (yelling at door)  Doug, you should check out this  room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just a big believer in  sharing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivica sensually lies back on the bed, staring at Steve.  Steve is uncomfortable, starts walking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, why don't you come over  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivica pats the bed a few times, inviting him over.  Steve watches.  Thinks.  Then goes over to the bed and  also pats it a few times, turning it into a drum solo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping him)  Steve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve stops, looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viv, you know what I heard when I  first met you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve starts making a very loud inappropriate shrill  ambulance siren sound -- over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an ambulance.  Coming to  take me away because the sight of  you just stopped my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve is very proud of his comment, and makes another  siren sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug is sitting next to Cambi, trying to think of  something to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be suave)  So, Cambi, can I ask you  something?  Do you like  blueberries or strawberries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what type of  pancakes to order you in the  morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks proud of his line as we begin to hear Steve O.S. -- from the next room -- making more SIREN SOUNDS, over  and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I was wondering...  (snaps, annoyed at  siren sound)  Steve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops siren sound)  ... Sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug starts looking at Cambi's shirt label.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking your label.  Just as I  thought.  Made in heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, you've gotten past the  opening line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, is that a mirror in your  pocket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I can see myself in your  pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Doug, if I said you had a  nice body, would you hold it  against me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)  What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and Vivica sitting on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this guy on the phone turns  around and he tips his hat like  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug does a "tip your hat" motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who do you think the guy was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivica is bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug is telling Cambi the same story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Steve was like 'Emilioooo!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve is telling the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Emilioooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug still telling story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilioooo!  And it was really him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your first time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Oh my God.  That is  hilarious.  That is so hilarious!  (yelling at the door)  Steve, did you hear that?  (to Cambi)  You don't even know how funny that  is.  You are funny.  You don't   even know how funny you are!  Man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambi pounces on Doug with a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivica is inches away from Steve's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivica, I've been thinking.  Our  relationship is really going  strong now.  We've had some great  times together that I'll never  forget.  Remember when I saw you  at the pool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I was just remembering back.  (sighs)  You know, an open dialogue is an  essential element to any  successful long term relationship.  I think we have something special  going on here and I don't want to  move too fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your first time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Isn't it yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivica smiles and pounces on Steve, knocking him OUT OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom doors simultaneously open.  Doug and Steve  excited, run into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, oh my god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  Did you just?  'Cause  I just!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is unbelievable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is historical!  This what  it's all about!  Up Top!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They high-five.  Doug suddenly catches himself,  changes  back to cool attitude -- Steve follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that it hasn't happened before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it was alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand there, posing cool, but awkward for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go back in the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.  I'll see you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run back in the bedrooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir's limo pulls up.  Doug and Steve get out, shut  door.  Car drives off.  The guys stand in place, in  reverie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Steve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  Are we A club people now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug looks at him -- then to answer, he pulls out a small piece of paper, shows it to Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a number!  Wooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woo!  We got a number!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They jump up and down, embracing, happy as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug is working feverishly at his desk.  There are phone  books, rolodex, staplers, notepads in front of him.  Steve enters with a shopping bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been?  We've got to  get ready for our business meeting  with Mr. Zadir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got some great new supplies for  our business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve starts pulling items out of the bag,  Doug doesn't  pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Post Its' to annotate important  documents.  'Little Post Its'  'cause you write smaller than me.  'While you were out' pads -- for  while you are out.  Scotch tape,  in case the Post Its lose their  adhesive-osity.  And mugs with our  names on them.  Yours says,  'Doug.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's what we're gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)  Did you call Mr. Zadir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, before you talk to a man like  Mr. Zadir, you have to have a fully  developed plan of attack.  You have  to have all your ducks in row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know to get ducks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we're going back to the dance  club idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Now you set up the office.  I'm gonna call some real estate  people to talk about locations.  At that point, I'd like to  schedule a meeting.  Can you do  tweleve thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug checks his Filofax.  Steve unwraps a new Filofax and starts looking through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  Be prepared to discuss  possible club names and themes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to schedule another  meeting for that.  Hey, you know  what?  Maybe we should have a pre-  meeting to brainstorm before our  scheduled meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  That way we won't look like  idiots at our meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  Okay, I'm gonna roll a  few calls.  We should order in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take care of that.  (to door)  Ma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug pulls out the phone, starts dialing.  Steve starts  organizing the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Steve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just thinking.  Dad would  really be proud of us right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both smile.  Mrs. Butabi enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, your father's furious.  You  were supposed to be at work an  hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, we're gonna have to do  some re-scheduling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, behind cash register, holding clipboard, on the  phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, hello, I'm interested in your  sound systems.  I've heard good   things about your woofers and     tweeters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve nods, knowing what to do.  He pulls a Post-It,  writes something down and sticks it on Doug's clipboard.  A LADY walks up with a small plant.  Doug puts a        " and we FOLLOW her TO Mr. Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi, where is the other  cash register?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash register.  There are several Post-Its stuck to the  counter.  Steve is filling out another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be with you in a second, Mrs.  Manicotti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi goes over to the cash register.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One second, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to see you're on a  break.  I mean, after all, you've  been here almost twenty minutes  now and it's hard work listening  to your walking man and ringing up  the one customer you've had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I'm sensing a note of sarcasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a very nice sign.  Except for  one thing.  (exploding)  This is the only register!  This is  why I pay you -- to push a button and  take the money.  Is that too much?  Is there some problem I don't know  about?  Did you injure your button  pushing finger in a bad cell phone  accident?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, why don't you go to Rexall's  Drug Store.  I think you need to  purchase a bottle of chill pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just when I thought I had you doing  the absolute minimum, you astound me  with how much less you can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your information, Dad, we are  working our asses off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, our week's filling up pretty  quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, last night, Steve and I  happen to have made a very  important business contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what are you dancing the  Macarena with Donald Trump?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you want me to go the drug  store to get those pills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should tell him now.  (excited)  Dad, you're gonna love this.  We're  working on this club idea which could  include many silk plant opportunities  and guess who we thought could be our  supplier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I need you to give me  opportunities.  I feed you, I clothe  you, I put a roof over your head and  I pay for your little phones so you  can call other idiots.  I give up on  you two.  I am ashamed to call you my  sons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go again, Dad.  You always  tell us to do something with our  lives and when we finally do, what  happens?  You got to put us down.  You never support us, you never  encourage us, and you never care  about what's important to us.  Right,  Steve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need a prescription for those  pills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my own fault.  I spoil you.  From now on, you are no longer  allowed to go out to clubs at  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now enough wasting time.  Go clean  up the stock room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, Poppason, not only  will Steve and I not clean the  stock room, but we are officially  out of here!  (to Steve)  Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug starts walking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about the stock room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We quit!  (turns back to Dad)  And we don't need you!  We made  big contacts last night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, plus we met these girls,  Dad, and you wouldn't believe what  happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dad)  We're gonna make it without you.  You'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug exits, Steve follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'll see tonight when you get  hungry and you come home to eat my  food.  And when you come crawling  to me for more money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve barrel out the front door and head  straight for the van.  Emily, in a sexy sun dress,  carrying two big huge oversized lightbulbs where her  breasts would be, steps in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Steve!  Do you want to go to  the beach later?  I've got my  bathing suit on under this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Emily)  Not now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug blows by Emily.  Beat.  He steps back INTO FRAME --  takes a second look at the odd bulb positions -- and  exits again.  The guys start getting into the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not talking to you, Doug.  You're an ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, we're experiencing a major  family crisis.  I'm gonna have to  take a rain check on this convo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve!  Car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he gets into  the car)  Nice bulbs, Emily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve gets in.  They PEEL OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells after them)  So, you want to go out tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys speed along on their way to Butabi.  Doug is  looking over a sheet of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, these are the ideas we'll  pitch him.  The Jungle Paradise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Inside Out Club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Civil War.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one needs work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  We'll hold off on that one.  And let's not forget our ace in  the hole -- The Naked Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should call it 'The  Nudist Colony.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like a strip club.  And this is a dance club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  We'll go with 'The  Naked Room.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silk van drives up.  Steve and Doug get out and walk  up to the locked gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zadir's gonna be excited to see  us.  This is it, bro...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug presses the intercom.  They wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug presses the intercom buzzer again.  No response.  As they wait, Steve starts to sing to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very softly)  'This is it, make your mistakes  where you are.  This is it...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We realize Steve is singing "This Is It" by Kenny  Loggins.  Doug slowly joins in as they pass the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '... We're going no further.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The both step singing as Doug hits the buzzer again.  After a beat of waiting, Steve picks up the song where  they left off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soloing much louder)  'Here!  The moment is now, no  place for goodbyes...'

dialogues.speaker: INTERCOM
dialogues.text: Male voice starts singing the next lyric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'And now I'm not so sure... doo  doo... deep in my heart...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: They stop singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys know 'Footloose'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running to  intercom)  Actually, we're here to see Mr.  Zadir.  It's Steve and Doug Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly to himself)  '... pick up your Sunday shoes...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were supposed to have a meeting  with him about our ideas.  Like  there's one where the inside is  outside and there's one about a  jungle and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shutting him up,  covering the  intercom)  Steve!  Never talk concepts with  the intercom.  (to intercom)  Can we come inside and wait for  him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we leave him a message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Doug)  Let's just forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay strong, sailor.  (to intercom)  Do you know where we can find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's at the office in Wilshire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They jump in the car and drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing 'Footloose')  ... 'Everybody cut, everybody  cut... doo doo.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a large engraved marble "Zadir Industries" sign  above the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see each elevator button is the name of Zadir's many  businesses (Zadir Dry Cleaners, Zadir Beepers, Zadir  Gaming & Entertainment, Zadir Real Estate, Executive  Suite).

dialogues.speaker: DOUG AND STEVE
dialogues.text: listen to a MUZAK VERSION of "WHAT IS LOVE" by Haddaway.  Their heads begin to bop very slowly.  A hot-looking  businesswoman gets on.  They guys smile politely and wait patiently.  We hear a DING.  The businesswoman gets off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Steve, did you notice we  forgot to ask her something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, 'What's up?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  That's weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's not.  We're both  involved in serious relationships  now, and our ladies know they can  trust us.  'Trust' being the key  element in any worthwhile  commitment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why go out for burgers when we've  got steak at home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  We should get lunch  after this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elevator doors open.  Doug and Steve exit onto a very  modern white glass floor.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTION AREA
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve walk over to a RECEPTIONIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve Butabi for Mr.  Zadir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're brothers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve give each other a look.  They're tempted  to tell their "brother joke."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, thanks for the setup, but  we really can't get into that  right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve looks down the hall of offices to his left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the hall, Mr. Zadir and Dooey quickly walk  by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, Mr. Zadir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys run down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you can't...!

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: The guys run past office files, they pass a Fed Ex woman. Steve stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry to disappoint you,  but I'm in a serious relationship  right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve immediately jumps back into full stride.

dialogues.speaker: END OF HALLWAY
dialogues.text: The guys turn a corner.

dialogues.speaker: CONFERENCE ROOM DOOR
dialogues.text: As Dooey closes the door, we see Mr. Zadir at the head of a board meeting.  Zadir does not see them.  Dooey turns  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dooey!  My very main man.  Up top!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys raise their hands to high five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dooey forcefully drags the guys by their shirts, through  the door and towards the elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincere)  So, Dooey, how's everything goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ragin' party last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, is that what my mother said  to you...  (indicating he heard  them in the limo)  ... or was it my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dooey drops the guys next to the elevator, presses the  down button, begins to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Zadir wants to have this  meeting by the elevators?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dooey stops and slowly turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those Redi Whip cans were a big hit  last night.  I was out till four in  the morning trying to find more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed)  From dusk 'til dawn -- you, sir, are  a party animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (threatening)  Don't go near Mr. Zadir.  He was  drunk last night and he doesn't even  remember you.  You think you're the  first losers he's picked up that I've  had to get rid of come Monday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Doo-man, I don't know if I'm  reading my diss-meter correctly.  Because are we being blown off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stay away if you know what's  good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dooey walks away.  The guys are in shock for a beat.  Suddenly, Doug bolts full speed past Dooey and back into  the office.  Dooey follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug runs up to the shut door and starts banging.  No  response.  He notices, to the left, a glass window  looking into the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zadir looks up -- we can't tell if he sees Doug or not.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Suddenly, two burly security guys pull Doug away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guys physically push the guys out the  building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to security)  Alright, so we'll see you guys later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guys, unfazed, walk back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys get in and sit there, depressed.  After a  beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't talk to you right now.  Give me a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just go back to  work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and maybe we should just go  to college and not put gel in our  hair and starts wearing blue jeans.  Let's do that, Steve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve suddenly gets an idea and reaches into the glove  compartment.  He pulls out the piece of paper with  Cambi's number on it -- we see he's put it in a small  lucite frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to cheer  Doug up)  Cambi's number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug looks up at the number, starts to come out of his  funk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a sweet time last night,  didn't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet ass time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diabetic.  I could see doing that  again, maybe even a couple a times  a week, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladies await, my friend.  Cell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve slaps a cellular phone into Doug's hand.  Steve  looks down, shifts again, they pull out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambi and Vivica are standing by the bar, talking to  AKIRO and TORONAGA, two middle-aged Japanese businessmen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think it's great how you  get to travel around the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese)  These hotties are sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese)  Sweet ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a PAGER GO OFF in Cambi's bag.  She checks the  beeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  It's just a bunch  of pound signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug is repeatedly pressing the phone pad over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure you're doing it  right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated)  Steve, you have to hit the pound  sign or it doesn't go through.  (sighs)  Maybe their phones aren't working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try putting in our number and then  hitting pound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. Bill Nye the  Science Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug starts putting in their number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambi is talking on a cellular phone near the table, as  Vivica entertains the Japanese businessmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambi.  It's your boyfriend.  I  need to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not knowing who it  is)  Uh... well, I'm at the Skybar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right there... sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve gives Doug a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van pulls up and the guys get out and head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's my hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long-term relationship good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's totally committed.  You know,  Doug, when things aren't going so  well, it really makes you realize  how much your woman means to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and Doug enter and are hit with the unwelcome sight of their girls flirting with the businessmen.  They strut over, ready to fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys bothering you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to businessmen)  You guys messing with our women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese)  What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to mix it up?  Come on!  Take me on.  I'm insane.  You  don't know what you're dealing with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The businessmen look at them strangely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivica, I'm feeling a little  vulnerable here.  I thought we had  an understanding.  And I can't  believe you're willing to just  throw away everything we've been  to each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, Steve, this is Akiro and  Toronaga... they're my cousins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve is relieved, Doug is mistrustful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding out hand to  shake)  Oh!  Well, it's about time that we  met the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling to Steve's  hand back)  Come on!  What do you think, we're  stupid?  How can they be your  cousins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like talking to a  child)  Well, his mother and my mother are  sisters and that makes us cousins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Oh.  Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Akiro and  Toronaga)  Would you excuse us a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we just got to talk to them  a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, 'cause we slept with them  last night so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambi and Vivica, Steve, Doug assemble near the Silk van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, did you guys have as good a  time last night as we did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a great time, Vivica.  In  fact, I think we've reached the  point where I can comfortably call  you 'Viv' and leave out the 'Ica.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you guys want to hang out or  see a movie or do what we did last  night... or eat or... just do what  we did last night or hang out, eat  and then do what we did last night  or... you know, whatever... and do  what we did last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambi gives Doug a kiss.  He melts, then quickly tries to act cool.  Vivica affectionately holds Steve's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viv, I'm glad our relationship is  strong enough to withstand the  hard times -- like when were  just in the bar -- I also think  we're not just projecting onto one  another but dealing with the  reality of who we are.  And most  important, we know how to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you boys want to go somewhere  quiet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls look at them seductively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in reference to  joke)  It's gold.  I'm telling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys high five and laugh -- they walk to the van.  Doug opens the passenger door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies, have your boarding passes  ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambi and Vivica just stand there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisle or window seat?  I'm sorry,  ma'am, you're gonna have to check  that bag... The movie on this  flight will be uh... I don't know.  I can't think of any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our dad got mad and took it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we used to work for him, but  we quit today so actually we're  unemployed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not in business with Mr.  Zadir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we are.  But, not now.  We  just met him last night.  But, we  will be.  So, no, but, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially, if we ever get to see  him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls digest this for a beat.  Cambi signals to  Vivica and they both start walking back to the bar.  The  guys, confused, run up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from us.

dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are a big waste of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Como what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, you're a jerkoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, consider what we did with  you last night a favor.  Now do us  a favor and never talk to us  again!

dialogues.text: What did we do wrong?  We'll  change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you can't change.  You and  your brother are ugly pathetic  losers.  (to Cambi)  That's the problem with  nightclubs.  Poor schmucks look  just the same as rich schmucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls walk back to the bar.  The guys watch them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they walk)  I can't believe we actually had  sex with those asswads.  I hope  the nips are still at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow-moving congestion.  We see the Silk van driving in  the middle of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve sit in silence for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to cheer  him up)  Hey, Doug, I think some of the  plants are beginning to wilt...  no, I'm just kidding.  They're  made out of silk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing quietly)  ... 'This is it.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)  Steve!  This is the worst day of  my life.  So, if you don't mind, I  really don't want to hear you talk  right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it hasn't been the Super Bowl  for me either...  (mumbling)  ... just trying to get you to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blowing up)  Talk?!  You want me to talk, Steve?!  I'll talk.  Blah-blah-blah, talk,  talk, talk!  I'm talking!  You feel  better now?!  Talk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know how to respond to  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ripping into him)  Oh, big surprise, Steve.  You don't  know how to do something.  You don't  know how to work the clubs, you don't  know how to talk to women.  The only  thing you know how to do is ask me  how to do everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why everthing's gone  wrong... 'cause you're holding me  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so needy all the time.  You're like this thing tied to my  leg, like this... dragging  thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lead weight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, a lead weight.  (sincere)  Thanks.  (back to angry)  And I am not letting you drag me  down anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You know, can't blame me for  what happened.  Today was a series  of random events gone awry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe events wouldn't go awry if I  had someone with a brain sitting  next to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.  Well, maybe I'd have  better events if I was with  someone with a higher level of  looks and taller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, in shock, starts to hyperventilate from anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathing heavily)  I'm tall enough to kick your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cupping his ear)  Did you say something?  It's hard  to hear things that low down to  the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well hear this.  Consider me your  ex-brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You care about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug fakes throwing a punch -- Steve flinches.  Steve  fake punches -- Doug flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the real thing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then stop talking to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue along in silence, both looking miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the Silk van parked in front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve lies on his bed looking out the window.  Doug's  bed is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: is sad.  Gets up, walks to Doug's desk and throws all the Post-its and business supplies in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple studio.  Doug dumps his belongings on the bed -- bottles of hair gel, colognes, aftershaves, etc.  He  picks up Cambi's framed number, yanks it out of the frame and rips it to shreds.  Then he sits back on the bed,  picks up remote and turns the TELEVISION ON.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION SCREEN
dialogues.text: Oddly enough, it's a rerun of "21 Jump Street" featuring  Richard Greico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lies!  All lies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug shuts it OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A depressed Steve is emotionally selling a plant to a  female customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly)  That's right, ma'am.  It's silk.  It'll always be in bloom.  It'll  never change.  It'll never die.  It'll never yell at you and call  you a 'loser.'  It'll always be in  your room where you left it, not  suddenly move out into the guest  house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The customer is crying.  Mr. Butabi walks over, pulls  Steve aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  All the  customers are depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking over at  empty register)  I'm just used to seeing Doug at  the register.  I miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's only in the guest house.  It's ten feet away.  It's like a  mansion in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is Cinemax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve walks off, upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, in skin-tight shiny body suit, is exercising on  the Peck Deck portion of a Nautilus machine -- filled  with people.  She finishes her last repetitions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine... ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops.  Then looks in a little workout book entitled  Diet to Get Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  One more set.  Add ten  pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bends down and pulls the metal pin out of the  weights.  The person next to her, using the lat bar, goes flying up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops.  Sorry.  Wrong pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve is doing sit-ups on a slant board.  Craig spots  him.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG AND STEVE
dialogues.text: Steve is straining, in mid-crunch.  Craig is eating a  Power Bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the neck -- the stomach.  Not  the thighs -- the stomach.  Not  the shoulders - the... Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ab citing!  Six pack in full  effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve rushes to mirror, holds up his shirt.  Craig  points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she cuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Steve.  Is that an ab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing Emily's  body)  Toned and tight, Emily.  Want to  power up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offers her a bite of his bar.  She ignores him.  Craig stands there chewing a Power Bar and drinking an "Ultra  Fuel" while they talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard about your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (avoiding eye contact)  What'd you hear about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father said you and him quit,  then you had a fight, then you  came crawling back to work like he  said you would and how your  brother didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, when are we going out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a place with good spinach  wraps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Emily, I know you've had  your heart set on this a long  time, but, the truth is we're from  two different worlds.  I mean, I'm  a rebel... and you're kind of the  sweet girl next door type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, I work next door.  It's not  a type, it's a location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean.  I don't  know if you can handle a guy like  me.  I'm used to more, like  experienced women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh.  You're forgetting -- I got to  college.  Translation -- drunken  orgies with occasional Cliff  Notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Cliff.  Weak delts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm not one of those date rape  crybabies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it sounds good, but I'm  getting over a very serious  relationship right now.  It's  gonna take some time to nurse  my emotional wounds.  And that  could take, like, until Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect, your dad bought us two  tickets to David Copperfield, this  Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let you know how I'm feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be fun to see things appear,  and then disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily grabs his face and shoves her tongue down his  throat for a beat and pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching Emily leave)  Tight glutes.  (sincere)  Steve, as a trainer.  I'm pretty  perceptive about picking up body  language... I think she likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cottage is dark.

dialogues.speaker: SUBTITLE
dialogues.text: Doug is unshaven, unkempt.  Disinterestedly flipping  channels.  He throws the remote away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Fine!  I won't watch Larry  Sanders!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gets up and exits.  We hear the VAN PEEL OUT.  Seperation MONTAGE BEGINS:

dialogues.text: Doug is drunk, trying to dance with a girl.  She  pushes him away into another girl who shoves him into  a biker guy -- who tries to dance with him.

dialogues.speaker: F
dialogues.text: The pool:  He can see Emily and Steve going at it on  air mattress.

dialogues.text: Steve and Emily are in bed -- pre-sex.  Steve is in a  pajama top.  Emily is in a black nightie and flipping  through a USC School of Business course guide.  Steve  kisses her neck, Emily keeps reading.  Steve reaches over and puts his hand on her breast.  Emily keeps reading.  He pulls his hand back.

dialogues.text: Here's one -- 'Business Computer         Systems.'

dialogues.text: (disinterested)  I'm not real good with machines.  That was Doug's thing.  I'm more  of a people person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, a businessman has to have a  knowledge of computers.  Ooo!  --  'Venture Management and Analysis.'  you have to take that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, my dad's giving me the  store anyway.  I don't really have  to go back to school.

dialogues.text: One store?  Yah... and maybe  we'll just have like one house and  one car.  Steve, we're gonna have  more than one store.  And you have  to be prepared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really want to go back to  school.  I'll have to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And homework and teachers always  asking you if you'd like to share  that with the rest of the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't upset me.  Unless you want  to make me less horny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that wouldn't be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing him)  Look, first, we combine the  stores, plants and lamps, then we  can add furniture, you know  recliners...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (progressively  getting closer  to orgasm)  And then we'll open a second store  in Orange County with dinette sets  and entertainment centers, and a  third in San Francisco and then  we'll be bigger than Ikea, oh my  God... Home Depot!  I, I, Ikeaaa!

dialogues.text: Emily orgasms and slides off Steve.

dialogues.text: (taking it as a  proposal)  Oh my God!  Steve!  You've made me  so happy!

dialogues.text: She hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset)  What?  No, no.  I meant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily quickly ducks OUT OF FRAME to perform oral sex on  STEVE -- who quickly stops being upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relaxes)  ... Oookay.

dialogues.text: Doug and Craig sit at a table with drinks.  Craig, in  suit and "Pump It" gym headband, bops in place.  Doug  doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, If I'm not mistaken, this  place has got it going on.  I owe  you big time for inviting me.

dialogues.text: Craig hands Doug a health bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The candy bar wrapper reads "Big Time -- Protein  Supplement for serious Bodybuilders."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wooooo!  Who wants to dance all  night long!  And I mean aaall  night!  Wooo!  (sits)  Doug, I am having a hell of a  time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, Craig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, do you think I should wear this  outfit to your brother's wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother's wedding?  What are you  gonna wear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dropping head to  table)  Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to hand it to Steve.  That  Emily's the perfect woman.  Strong  legs, low body fat, and a positive  mental attitude.  A lady like that  can really keep you on track.  Is it  okay to wear black at an afternoon  affair?

dialogues.text: Shut up, you idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, I know you and your brother  are having some problems, but that  is no reason to refer to my  intellectual capacity in a  diminutive manner.

dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Craig, but you totally  Wolf Blitzerd me with the  matrimony update.  Do you mind if  we just don't talk about my  brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten-Four.  Boundary set.

dialogues.text: (perking himself  back up)  Look, did we come here for some  Starbucks' latte chitchat or did  we come here to hit on hotties?

dialogues.text: Hotties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: BAR
dialogues.text: The guys walk over to the back of a blonde woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sweetness, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman turns around -- it's ELLEN DEGENERES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fine thing, you got it going  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  I was worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you want to shake it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think I'll just let it sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that I've met you, I'm more  sure than I've ever been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a...  (makes alien hand  signal and sounds)  ... close encounter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be back.  Just playing hard  to get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am having a hell of a time!  Wooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with the entire Butabi and Anderson family,  including old folks.  This is the pre-wedding rehearsal  dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the hors d'oeuvers are hummus  dip and babaganoush...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's going to eat that?  You  should have pigs in the blanket  and chicken fingers.
