dialogues.text: Steve is sticking a spoon on his nose.  Mr. Butabi takes  it and taps his glass, standing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  A toast to Steve and Emily,  who after tommorow will be Mr. and  Mrs. Steve Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily Anderson-Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.  Okay.  Well... to whoever  they turn out to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing up)  I would also like to thank  everyone for flying in to join us.  My brother and his wife from  Chicago.  My parents who came in  all the way from Maine despite  Mom's sciatica.  And the Butabis  who came all the way in from Yee-  men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting him)  Yemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever the hell that is.  I'm  just kidding.  And that's not the  only union I'm excited about.  From what I understand, we got a  new lamp/plant store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's plant/lamp store.  Ha  ha... that's a joke.  But,  seriously, I think it sounds  better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, don't you want to make a  toast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing him up)  All the men are doing it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing)  So, okay, uh... I just want to  say... what's up... Grandpa,  Grandma, and those other two old  people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve sits.  Emily quickly stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think what Steve means, is that,  we're just thrilled with the way  this family is coming together.  And I'd like to share with you  some of our business plans for  after the merger.  (to Grandma)  Can you pass these out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily hands out business plan folders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will get more wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi is looking through a wine rack.  Steve enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad, do you think maybe we  could cancel this whole thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sure...  (turns to Doug)  ... Nooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, that's so funny.  But I  really don't want to get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are serious?  All these people  are here and you are serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, it's like, Emily had turned  into this whole different person.  I mean, at first, she was this  girl that I really liked to have  sex with.  Then she turned into  this other girl who I really don't  want to marry -- although I don't  mind having sex with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the catering is paid for.  The tents are all set up.  Your  grandparents flew half way around  the world.  Besides, all men go  through the same thing the night  before their wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, all guys feel sort of  nervous and anxious, and kind of  hope a train hits her and she eats  a can of botulism or maybe she  could hang out with a deer, and a  hunter accidently shoots her or  you know, when she's sleeping and  she makes that nose whistle sound  and you shake her to make it quiet  but what you'd really like to do  is take her stupid red toothbrush  and ram it up her nostril into her  skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi stares at him for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, these feelings are  perfectly normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wedding chairs.  Tents.  Flowers.  Suddenly, we hear a  KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Doug ducks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, in his pajamas, knocks at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug?  Doug?  You there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve pulls put his cell phone, dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug's CELL RINGS, he picks up and makes believe he's a  machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've reached Doug Butabi.  I'm  not home right now -- because  I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... out living it up, unlike my  pussywhipped brother who's busy  throwing his life away and will  spend the rest of his years  selling silk plants for  Emillyyy...  (making beeping sound)  ... Beeeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (assuming it's real)  Doug, sorry I missed you.  I guess  you heard I'm gettng married  tommorow.  I was just wondering if  you wanted to be my best man.  See  ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve exits.  Doug peels through the window at him.

dialogues.speaker: EXT BUTABI BACK YARD
dialogues.text: Beautiful wedding layout.  Guests mill about.  Craig is lifting an ice sculpture off it's base.  Steve is next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, I know you can lift it.  Now can you just listen to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting down  sculpture)  I got it.  I walk down the aisle.  I stand next to you.  And I settle  any inter-wedding party  skirmishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're the best man.  Not the  wedding bouncer.  You just gotta  back me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you mean like spotting you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I get it.  If things get too  heavy, I step in.  Like a  relationship spotter.  (overwhelmed)  Thank you, man.  I won't let you  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FATHER WILLIAMS, a grey-haired priest, Phil Donahue-type, walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, boys, we're about ready to  start.  You look very nice,  Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Father.  I love what  you're wearing also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in regular black priest garb.  He exits, confused.

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF WEDDING AISLE
dialogues.text: Steve walks up to Mr. Butabi, who is waiting with the  procession.  WEDDING MARCH BEGINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Dad, I've been thinking.  I didn't really have time to have  a bachelor party and that's a  pretty important part of the  marriage experience.  So, we may  want to consider delaying the  wedding a couple of hours so we  can go to a strip club or  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh!  We're starting.

dialogues.speaker: WEDDING AISLE
dialogues.text: Richard Grieco, in tux, walks down the aisle with a  frumpy BRIDESMAID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Grieco?  How do you know  Steve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I just don't want to be  sued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, the best man, begins walking down with the maid of honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to maid of honor)  Alright... it's a long walk...  pace yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig takes pulse, looks at his watch.  Grandma and  Grandma Butabi walk down the aisle.  As they approach  Craig...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)  Grandma, you look unbelievable!  Woo!

dialogues.speaker: MR. BUTABI AND STEVE AND BARBARA
dialogues.text: Walk  down the aisle.  Steve is wearing a CD walkman --  Mr. Butabi notices and yanks it off.  They pass a pretty  girl.  Steve veers off course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to girl)  What's up?  You from out of town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi pulls Steve back on course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns back to girl)  See you at the reception.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: and her parents walk down the aisle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve!  Getting married!  Go for  it!  You are the man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling up to Craig)  Shut up, Craig! I'm walking down  the aisle, you dick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily goes back to walking gracefully.  MARCH ENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dearly beloved, we are gathered  here today, to join together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father?  Did we already start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Sorry I thought there was  going to be a buzzer or whistle or  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... To join together this man and  this woman in holy matrimony.  If  any man can show any just cause  why these two should not be  lawfully joined together, speak  now or forever hold his peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody speaks.  Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am having a hell of a time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good.  Now I understand the  bride and groom have each prepared  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying  to rhyme)  Dear Steve, today I wear this  wedding gown, and on my face there  is no frown.  I know our lives  together will be great, just like  when we saw David Copperfield on  our first date.  If you set  something free and it comes back,  you should love it forever, and  like one of your silk plants, I'll  try to stay beautiful, that is my  endeavor.  Love, forever, Emily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve steps forward, takes out a piece of paper, reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, I used to see you outside  my father's store.  And then we  went out on some dates and you let  me have sex with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve steps back.  Priest looks to see if Steve's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice.  Steven, do you promise  to love Emily, comfort her, honor  her, in sickness and in health, as  long as you both shall live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father already paid the caterer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, do you promise to comfort  Steve, and honor him in sickness  and health, as long as you both  shall live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi hands Steve the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Steven, repeat after me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'After me'... just kidding.  I'm  nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now repeat after me, with this  ring I thee wed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this ring, I thee wed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve puts the ring on her finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Emily, repeat after me.  With  this ring, I thee wed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With This ring --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the ceremony is interrupted by the sound of the GARAGE DOOR OPENING -- revealing...

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: holding a huge boom box over his head, confidently  standing in place.  Emily rolls her eyes.  Mr. Butabi's  angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in shock)  Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug hits the play button.  "WHAT IS LOVE?" by Haddaway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to organ player)  Let's just keep it going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi, I can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just ignore him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)  Say 'With this ring I thee...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this ring --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug TURNS UP the VOLUME, drowning out Emily.  Steve starts bopping his head.  Doug bops his head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Dad.  (turns back)  Emily, I'm sorry.  I'm not ready  yet.  I liked your poem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve starts walking towards Doug.  Mr. Butabi, furious  follows him and reaches to stop him.  Suddenly, a hand  pulls him on his back.  We REVEAL it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Butabi, but as best  man, my primary duty is to allow  the groom to beat a hasty retreat  should the occasion take a sudden  ugly turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butabi tries to get around.  Craig jumps in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't test me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve runs up to Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run out of the back yard.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GRIECO
dialogues.text: Puts his arm around Mr. Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi, as an actor, I'm a  keen observer of human nature.  And, I can tell that neither of  your sons are anywhere near the  maturity level necessary for this  sort of commitment.

dialogues.speaker: ALTAR
dialogues.text: Emily is furious.  Craig steps in the groom's spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily, with all due respect to  Steve, his discipline is lacking  as is his appreciation for you.  I, on the other hand, can bench  press 305 lbs.  I squat a clean  525, and my body fat percentage is  less than two percent.  Not only  am I a professional trainer, but I  someday hope to market my own  protein bars and produce an Iron  Buns video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily considers this a moment, then puts her arm through  his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Okay... We should look into  infomercials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and Doug are on the bridge tossing rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and I also took Craig out  clubbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was alright.  Plus, I rented  a lot of videos and I didn't do  much else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I, uh, I don't know... I  just... Steve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve is still looking at the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry.  I said a lot of  bad things before and... lately...  I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking, you know...  You're my brother... we're  brothers and when we're together,  you know... You just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry MacGuire theme "SECRET GARDEN" by Springsteen begin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotional)  You don't drag me down, Steve... I  drag me down, me!  And you... you  complete me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve walks up to Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.  Just shut up!  You had  me at hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug and hold one another as the MUSIC SWELLS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guests are gone.  In the empty tent, Richard Grieco  sits alone drinking wine with Mr. Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it seems to me that you're a  little bit harder on Doug than you  are on Steve.  Isn't that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are right.  It's just that  Doug is so rebellious, so hard to  control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebellious?  Scrappy?  Dreamer,  maybe?  What other young man does  that remind you of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Butabi has an epiphany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard nods, knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who are you really fighting  with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Richard Grieco, you see right  through me.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: We PAN UP the front of the red BMW to reveal Doug and  Steve in their usual positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug looks at his hair in the passenger sideview mirror.  Then he looks in the vanity mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed this car.  I look good in  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you do, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it...  (gets an idea)  Oh... And... you know, you look  good also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appreciating Doug's  gesture)  Thanks, bro.  I'm glad you moved  back in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad was kind of a sport about the  wedding once Richard Grieco talked  to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and isn't it a kick in the  head how Emily hooked up with  Craig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny.  The infomercial  really makes you want to buy those  Power Bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Infomercial.  Craig and Emily in leotards, pitching their "Un-fat"  bars.  A chunky silhouette is superimposed -- getting  thinner and thinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That silhouette chick is hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billboard ad of Gilbert Gottfried and Bob Saget in a TNT  special movie -- "Orville & Wilbur -- Brothers in  Flight."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to remember to tape them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An antique airplane is taking off.  Gilbert Gottfried in  turn of the century garb, watches the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  Yes, we're in flight!  Yes!  No!  No, that's down.  We don't  want from down.  We want up!  Yes!  Up is good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I wonder whatever happened to  Vivica's cousins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Akiro and Toronaga are on the bridge -- same positions  that Doug and Steve were in.  A japanese version of Bruce Springsteen's "SECRET GARDEN" is playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiyamo tomaga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayama, Tokayama!  Ko ma sayagan a  suma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace.  MUSIC SWELLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, get in the other lane,  there's an accident.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Dooey is lying under a totaled limo, surrounded by cans  of Reddi-whip.  However, the boys don't notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, I can't believe all that  stuff got wrapped up in one day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (notices something  outside)  Hey, check it out...

dialogues.speaker: NEW CLUB
dialogues.text: Outside, people sit on couches and listen to music, even  though they are waiting in line to get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second, that was your idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was killer.  Bound to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They park, get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys walk up.  A huge BOUNCER steps in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!  No one gets in unless they  talk to the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Well we're on the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and Doug Butabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bouncer checks the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butabi... Great.  Step right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)  ... Okaaay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we should go in then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys suspiciously enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls look like building facades, we see cars parked  inside, the main dance floor covers a lit body of  water with fish underneath.  The guys look astounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you lke our place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I cut you in.  It was your  idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet ass sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They high five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not all sweet asses.  Running  a club is a lot of hard work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bouncer comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zadir, we've got a situation  at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take care of it, Mr. Zadir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambi and Vivica are arguing outside with another  bouncer.  Doug and Steve appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the manager then!  We're  always on the list!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I'm the owner.  Is  there a problem here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, or jerkoff as you like to  put it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you're not gonna hold that  against is.  Just let us in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to bouncer)  Good job.  Don't let these or any  other predatory lowlife strumpets  in the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only 'cause it's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On line, we see the Switchboard Operator from the credit  center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That voice sounds so familiar...

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: He pricks up his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, is that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Switchboard operator walks up to Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They mentally put the voice with the face and are  immediately attracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're even more beautiful than  you sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stopped calling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not because I didn't want to...  (nervous)  Am I what you expected?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I totally approve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're lost in each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (being helpful)  Hey, Doug.  Do you have the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not getting it)  Eleven thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, do you have the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)  Steve, I think it's working out,  but thanks for your help...  (to Operator)  Come on into my club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've got my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The female Police Officer who earlier pulled them over is her friend.  Steve steps over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hottie police officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violater of posted speed limits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was really looking forward to  meeting you at the municipal court  on or before June sixth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "WHAT IS LOVE" by Haddaway comes over the outdoor  speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I love this song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In all honesty, I'm a little sick  of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good one.  Where do you come up  with this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Every once in a  while I strike pay dirt.  Let's  shake it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUSIC rises as they all dance and we...

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK.
dialogues.text: As CREDITS ROLL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Steve stand at the entrance, wearing headsets.  A CLUB GOER walks up.  Doug steps in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa.  Name please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil Platt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me check the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both check their lists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, step right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The confused guy goes in.  Girl steps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa Horowitz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks list)  Nope.  You can go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILIO ESTEVEZ approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estevez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emillliooooo!
